TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was the deputy chairman of the pro - NORP HADEP ( PERSON – ORG ) prior to the events giving rise to the present application .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was taken into custody by police officers from the anti - terror branch of ORG . According to the arrest protocol ( yakalama tutanağı ) signed by CARDINAL police officers and the applicant , a search warrant had been issued in respect of the applicant . When the officers saw the applicant , they asked him to show his identity card . The applicant however attempted to escape .

CARDINAL . On DATE the deputy director of ORG sent a letter to the public prosecutor at ORG requesting that the applicant ’s custody period be extended . The deputy director maintained , inter alia , that the applicant had been taken into custody on DATE during the course of a police operation carried out against the ORG and that the police had not yet completed the detailed questioning of the applicant and the gathering of evidence .

CARDINAL . NORP The public prosecutor referred the security directorate ’s request to ORG . On DATE , the single judge of ORG decided to extend the custody period for DATE starting from DATE , including DATE . The applicant did not appear before the judge .

CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL police officers from the anti - terror branch of ORG took statements from the applicant . The applicant was questioned , in particular , about his statements made in several television programmes , broadcast on ORG , a pro - NORP channel , in which he had taken part in his capacity as deputy chairman of the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was brought before the public prosecutor at ORG , who questioned him about his statements during the same television programmes . Subsequently , the public prosecutor requested ORG to order the applicant ’s detention on remand .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the single judge at ORG ordered the applicant ’s release from detention , having regard to the nature of the alleged offence and the state of the evidence .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor requested that ORG file a bill of indictment , charging the applicant with aiding and abetting members of the ORG on account of his statements made during the television programmes shown on ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE new legislation ( Law no . DATE ) on the suspension of proceedings and the execution of sentences regarding offences committed before DATE came into force .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to defer the imposition of a final sentence on the applicant , pursuant to PERSON no . DATE . The court held , under LAW of the same law , that the criminal proceedings against him would be suspended and a final sentence would be imposed should he be convicted of a similar offence within DATE of this decision .
CARDINAL . A description of the relevant domestic law at the material time can be found in GPE v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § CARDINAL , DATE ) .
